RelatedSentence: When people head to the polls Tuesday to vote in the Arkansas primary , they 'll find the majority of contested races on the Republican side of things .

When people head to the polls Tuesday to vote in the Arkansas primary , they 'll find the majority of contested races on the Republican side of things .
When people head to the polls Tuesday to vote in the Arkansas primary , they 'll find the majority of contested races on the Republican side of things .
The GOP has races with multiple candidates at the national , state and local level .
On the Democratic side , former congressman Mike Ross is expected to defeat primary opponent Dr. Lynette Bryant .
Of the state 's four federal congressional districts , two districts feature contested Republican races .
In District 4 , which covers Hot Springs and most of the state 's western half , businessman Tommy Moll faces off against State Representative Bruce Westerman .
The Secretary of State 's office has predicted 20 percent voter turnout .
